text: Dr. Akuma Divine Saningong is a Cameroonian-German keynote speaker, author, and molecular biotechnologist ==Education and research== Saningong studied Biotechnology at the Darmstadt University of Applied Sciences, where he graduated in 2004. He later earned a master's degree in Molecular Biotechnology from the Technical University Munich (TUM), focusing on epigenetics. He completed a Ph.D. at the University of Duisburg-Essen from 2006 to 2010. His research was about Par14 and Par17 proteins and how they interact with chromatin. ==Career== In 2011, Saningong joined EurA AG as an innovation manager and head of research and development. He worked there until 2015. In 2020, he created the Epi-Health Innovation and Research Network to use technology and biology to improve health. In 2021, Saningong founded KAC- Afrika GmbH, an initiative to encourage economic cooperation between Africa and Europe. Saningong has spoken at various international events, including TEDx talks and the World Biotechnology Congress in Berlin. ==Recognition== Saningong was named in African Heritage Magazine's list of "100 Most Influential Africans in Germany" in 2015 and 2016. ==References== ==Other websites== *Saningong at Google Scholar *Saningong at WorldCat *Saningong at ResearchGate Category:Living people Category:Molecular biologists Category:German biochemists
title: Akuma Saningong
